purpleculture_examples:
藤椅 [ téng yǐ ]: rattan chair
紫藤 [ zǐ téng ]: wisteria
顺藤摸瓜 [ shùn téng mō guā ]: lit. to follow the vine to get to the melon; to track sth following clues
藤条 [ téng tiáo ]: rattan
葛藤 [ gé téng ]: tangle of vines; fig. complications

heisig_chinese_memo: According to legend, the great rattan palm tree grew and flowered from magical rice grains that were planted under the quarter moon.
heisig_constituent: wisteria, flowers, edam, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, quarter, grains of rice
koohiiStory1: According to legend, the great Ogaki wisteria tree grew and flowered from magical rice grains that were planted under the quarter moon.
koohiiStory2: The wisteria is a type of hanging vine covered with flowers. By the light of the quarter moon, the flowers look like clusters of rice grains.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The only flowers that the moon gladiators will water are wisteria.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The moon gladiators have a thing for wisterias.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Since they're on the moon, where did they get the wisteria from? Actually, from one of the points on earth that is nearest to the moon, Mt. Fuji (ふじ).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine them reaching down from the moon and plucking some wisteria up from Mt. Fuji then taking them back up to the moon. Now they water them.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 艾 (мокса), 月 (месяц), 水 (вода)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the grass (艹) in the rising water (滕) is wisteria
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: According to legend, the great rattan palm tree grew and flowered from magical rice grains that were planted under the quarter moon.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "艸" to " Teng ", it is a generic term for the trailing plant white vine and wisteria. Southern Dynasty Qi Xie Tiao "Jingting Mountain": "The vines are barren and the vines grow, and the branches rise and fall."

" Vine " can borrow a finger stick. Qing Huang Jingren's "Song for the Recovery of Disease": "So far, I laughed dumbly in my song, and Huteng forcefully staggered."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "艸" to " Teng ", it is a generic term for the vines, white vine and wisteria.
humanum_full_description:
從「艸」，「滕」聲，是蔓生植物白藤、紫藤等的通稱。南朝齊謝朓〈敬亭山〉：「交藤荒且蔓，樛枝聳復低。」

　　「藤」可借指手杖。清黃景仁〈病愈作歌〉：「我歌至此啞然笑，呼藤彊立行蹣跚。」
humanum_short_description: 從「艸」，「滕」聲，是蔓生植物白藤、紫藤等的通稱。

從「 艸 」，「 滕 」聲，是蔓生植物白藤、紫藤等的通稱。南朝齊謝朓〈敬亭山〉：「交藤荒且蔓，樛枝聳復低。」 「 藤 」可借指手杖。清黃景仁〈病愈作歌〉：「我歌至此啞然笑，呼藤彊立行蹣跚。」
From the sound of " 艸" to " Teng", it is a generic term for the trailing plant white vine and wisteria. Southern Dynasty Qi Xie Tiao "Jingting Mountain": "The vines are barren and the vines grow, and the branches rise and fall." " Vine" can borrow a finger stick. Qing Huang Jingren's "Song for the Recovery of Disease": "So far, I laughed dumbly in my song, and Huteng forcefully staggered."

藤字的基本解释

藤
téng
指“白藤”、“紫藤”：藤条。藤椅。藤床。
〔藤黄〕a.常绿乔木，茎高达二十米，树脂黄色，有毒；b.这种植物的树脂，可作国画颜料。
泛指匍匐茎或攀援茎：藤本植物。瓜藤。葡萄藤。顺藤摸瓜。

藤字的汉语字典释义

[①]［téng］
［《廣韻》徒登切，平登，定。］
亦作“籐1”。
(1)蔓生植物白藤、紫藤等的通称。
(2)指植物的匍匐茎或攀援茎。
(3)借指手杖。

藤字的英文翻译

◎ 藤
bine, ratan, rattan, vine

藤字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　藤； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页1065第46
【唐韻】【正韻】?徒登切，音騰。【說文】藟也。今總呼草蔓延如藟者。　又【集韻】苰藤，草名。胡麻也。　又州名。【韻會】隋攺永平州爲藤州。【唐書·李嗣眞傳】來俊臣獄興，嗣眞上書，流藤州。

藤字的源字形

藤字的起名意思

：木本蔓生植物的枝茎。藤蔓、枝藤。

rattan
Basic explanation of words
rattan
téng
Refers to "white cane" and "wisteria": rattan. Wicker chair. Rattan bed.
[Garcinia] a. Evergreen tree with stems up to 20 meters high, resin yellow, poisonous; b. The resin of this plant can be used as a paint for Chinese painting.
Refers generally to stolons or climbing stems: vines. Melon vine. Vines. Follow the vine.
rattan
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［téng］
["Guangyun" Tu Dengqi, Ping Deng, Ding. ]
Also known as "Vine 1".
(1) Generic term for trailing plants such as white vine and wisteria.
(2) Refers to the stolon or climbing stem of a plant.
(3) Borrowing a cane.
rattan

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Zong Zi] 　藤; Kangxi strokes: 21; Page number: page 1065 to 46
【Tang Yun】【Zheng Yun】? Tu Dengqie, Yin Teng. [Said Wen] Ming Ye. Nowadays, the grass spreads like a scorpion.　[Jiyun] vine, grass name. Flax also.　Also the name of the state. 【Rhyme Club】Sui Ye Yongping Prefecture is Tengzhou. [Book of Tang·Li Siyu Biography] Come to Junchen Prison Xing, Sisu writes, Liutengzhou.
rattan
Source glyph
rattan
Name meaning
: Branches and stems of woody trailing plants. Vines, branches and vines.
藤
形声字。州(+)表意,其古文字形体像草,表示藤与草相似;滕(teng)表声,滕有水涌义,藤蔓弯曲的样子有如波涌。
本义是蔓生植物。
①蔓生植物名:一萝|紫~「白~。②泛指植物攀援茎:
~蔓「瓜~「顺~摸瓜。

ротанг
Пиктофонетические символы.
Чжоу (+) означает, что его древние символы напоминают траву, что означает, что виноградные лозы похожи на траву; Тэн (тенг) выражает звук, Тэн имеет значение воды, а виноградные лозы изогнуты, как волны.
Первоначальное значение - виноградное растение.
①Название висячего растения: Илуо | Пурпурный ~ "Белый ~". ②Это относится к вьющемуся стеблю растения: ~ лоза "гуа" Шун ~ могуа.

iZ: 4 Лечение 1:
téng
I сущ.
1) ползучие (вьющиеся) растения; лоза, плеть, лиана; изготовленный плетением лоз; плетёный
藤阴 тень от вьющихся растений
葡萄藤 виноградная лоза
藤箱子 плетёная корзина для вещей
椅子的藤心 плетёное сиденье стула
2) камыш; тростник
藤棍 палка из тростника
3) ротанговая пальма (триба Calameae); ротанг (материал)
II собств.
Тэн (фамилия)
Radicals: 艹, 月, 水,  (flowers, moon, water, gladiator)
Meaning Mnemonic
The only flowers that the moon gladiators will water are wisteria.
The moon gladiators have a thing for wisterias.
Reading Mnemonic
Since they're on the moon, where did they get the wisteria from? Actually, from one of the points on earth that is nearest to the moon, Mt. Fuji (ふじ).
Imagine them reaching down from the moon and plucking some wisteria up from Mt. Fuji then taking them back up to the moon. Now they water them.
